Job Title: Associate, Investment Operations and Trading 

Location: Atlanta, GA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Customer Service, Finance, General Business

Description:
About CressetPrivate equity entrepreneurs Eric Becker and Avy Stein founded Cresset Capital Management with a vision to reinvent wealth management and with a firm belief that clients deserve better. Cresset offers individuals and families access to a comprehensive suite of family office services, deeply personalized wealth management, investment advisory, planning, and other services through Cresset Asset Management, an SEC registered Investment Advisor, which has surpassed $40 billion in assets under management. Cresset Partners, our private investing group, offers clients direct access to real estate, private equity, and other investment opportunities. Since Cresset’s inception in 2017, the firm has grown to over 450 team members in more than twenty offices throughout the United States. Cresset ranks #9 on Barron’s list of the top 100 RIA firms.Our company is actively seeking an Associate, Investment Operations & Trading, who will be a key member of the Investment Operations & Trading team. One of the many services that Cresset provides involves managing portfolios for individuals/families and their related businesses or charitable entities. Experience with trading and using custodial platforms and order management/portfolio rebalancing systems is preferred.Responsibilities include:Investment Operations SupportDevelop an understanding of the firm’s investment platform and portfolio managementUtilize technological skills to effectively problem solve, drive operational efficiency, improve processes, ensure accuracy, and elevate client valueAssist with department controls and compliance reportingAssist in troubleshooting issues related to trading, portfolio management, investments, etc. Assist with data management of trading and rebalancing platform, and related technologyProactive and timely communicationTradingAccurate and timely execution of incoming trade requests submitted by advisorsDevelop a comprehensive understanding of trading strategies for a multitude of asset types, including but not limited to equities, mutual funds, interval funds, fixed income, options, etc.Post-trade reconciliation to identify and resolve discrepancies in a timely mannerProblem solve and quickly correct trade issues, including errors, allocation or settlement issues and initiating trade corrections as needed to minimize market risk Assist and train advisors on tools related to trading and rebalancing platform In addition to these core responsibilities, the Associate, Investment Operations & Trading may also be involved in supporting key initiatives, ad hoc projects, and other efforts at both the department and firm level. It is critical that the Associate, Investment Operations & Trading possess strong communication skills, be self-motivated, comfortable juggling multiple tasks and priorities, capable of working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and is eager to foster and deepen relationships in order for Cresset to best serve its clients and continue to grow as successfully as it has since its inception.Qualifications:Bachelor's degree required in Business, Finance, or related field1-2 years of experience in wealth management preferredExperience trading equities is requiredExtremely high attention to detail & analytical thinker with the ability to perform tasks with a high degree of accuracy and efficiencyExceptional organizational and time management skillsStrong math skills Excellent communication skills, both written and oralProficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook)Strong computer skills, specifically Microsoft Excel advanced functions including Pivot Tables, vLookups, etc., Experience with Power BI a plusExperience with Addepar, RedBlack, and Salesforce a plusStrong focus on continuous process improvement, including innovating, adopting, and leading best practicesAbility to learn and adapt to new technology Cultivate a strong investment and wealth management knowledge base across public and private marketsDemonstrated passion for delivering exceptional client serviceMust be a team player willing to contribute in a variety of ways to advisor teams and the broader Cresset teamAbility to develop and maintain collaborative relationships internally and externally with custodian partners and technology vendorsAbility to exercise judgment in managing confidential or sensitive informationComply with all client, firm, and regulatory requirementsHigh degree of professionalism and flexibility and able to perform successfully in a service-oriented, fast-paced, high-growth and frequently changing environment and aligned with Cresset’s values and cultureWhat We OfferAt Cresset, we focus on people first. As a service business, our people are our assets. Engaging our clients and employees is our highest priority. As such, Cresset offers a competitive compensation package including an annual incentive and a benefits package to all full-time employees including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401(k) retirement plan, health savings accounts, short and long-term disability insurance, voluntary critical and accident insurance, and pre-tax parking and transportation programs. Aligning employee and organizational interests, all employees receive equity in Cresset. Equal Employment OpportunityIt is the policy of Cresset to ensure equal employment opportunity (EEO) for all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation, or related conditions), national origin or ancestry, age, disability, veteran status, uniformed servicemember status, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a parent, genetic information (including testing and characteristics), or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. It is Cresset’s policy to comply with applicable laws concerning the employment of persons with disabilities, including reasonable accommodation for applicants and employees with disabilities.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
